name: Kijiji Tech
description:
Hi from Kijiji’s Tech & Product team!

Ever wondered how many transactions are happening on Kijiji's online platform everyday? Yes, MILLIONS.

We want to share with you our tools, process and what we are seeing next. Come join our events at our own pretty cool office in downtown Toronto and meet the fine folks who are making impacts to Canadian lives!

Topics include:

Back-End Development (Java, Clojure, Ruby, Python, Solr, Docker), Front-End Development (Node.js, React, ES, Babel) & UX Design (speaker session & workshops)

… and more to come!

We have also hosted events for external organizations such as Women Who Code, IxDA Toronto, Apache Spark etc. Contact us if you are interested in collaborating with us!


--Follow us on twitter @KijijiTech

name: Capital District Javascript Group
description: We're a group of web developers looking to mix and mingle with other folks leveraging Node.js for new and exciting solutions - all levels are welcome. We're prepared to meet, discuss, lecture, hack and code with this event driven, server-side platform built on V8 and see what we can learn, share & create. supporting technology like client-side JavaScript development & NoSQL data storage is fair game too. We're open to taking the group in any direction the membership wants to go... but yo, we're keeping our base in the 12180: Troy NY

name: East Bay JavaScript Meetup Group
description:
Come discuss Javascript with some of the most talented programmers in the East Bay. Show off some of the cool projects you've been working on and talk about everything happening in the JS community. Let's share tips, tricks, hacks and frameworks! We don't have a JavaScript group in the East Bay so I thought I'd start one. Our first topic is an intro to Node. Come check it out!

 

Logo provided by Oakland's Where It's AT-AT. http://www.oaklandiswhereitsatat.com/

name: Bonner Microservices Meetup
description: Tausch Dich mit Entwicklern und anderen technisch Interessierten zum Thema Microservices aus. Es gibt 2 Vorträge von jeweils 25 Minuten mit anschließendem Q&A. Danach geht es in den gemütlichen Teil über. Erfahrungsaustausch und Fachsimplen bei einem Bier zu den Themen: API, Cloud, Docker, Continuous Delivery, Node und Java.

name: DevDuck
description:
DevDuck to jedyny w swoim rodzaju, niepowtarzalny event dla programistów, których jarają tylko najnowocześniejsze technologie.


Nasz focus to popularyzowanie wiedzy o nowoczesnym i dynamicznie rozwijającym się środowisku JavaScript, w tym Node.js, React.js, Electron, AngularJS, itp. Organizujemy wykłady i workshopy, pokazujemy, że JS to język idealny do tworzenia zarówno back-endu, jak i front-endu.


Pasjonujesz się JavaScript'em? Chcesz być na bieżąco ze światowymi trendami? Zaczerpnąć wiedzy od doświadczonych kolegów po fachu? 

Wpadnij do nas!

organizer.name: Mateusz Warcholinski
organizer.bio:
Co-Founder / CEO / All-rounder 
COO of Brainhub (www.brainhub.eu) - Node.js & Mobile Software House
Musician

name: Nodeschool Schiphol
description: Nodeschool. is a set of do-it-yourself open source workshops created by the community, for the community. After installing you can step through the lessons for each topic at your own pace, learning how to use node.js, npm and other related tools by writing code to solve realistic problems. You can take the lessons yourself online if you're interested – NodeSchool events are a great incentive to work through the workshops with fellow local developers, sharing advice if you're ever stuck or are curious about alternative solutions.

organizer.name: JP Wesselink
organizer.bio: NodeSchool Organizer, enfant terrible, metal head.

name: Code and Coffee OC
description:
Whether you are a total beginner or well experienced, we welcome you to join us if you are interested in code pairing,enhancing your technical skills in JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS, Angular.js, Node.js. and much more. 

We started this for anyone currently taking the Free Code Camp courses online (at www.freecodecamp.com) hoping to connect with a local campers in Orange County, CA, but have expanded to those interested in learning other programming languages and related technical skills. 

If you would like to host an event or have a venue in mind, feel free to reach out!

next_event.name: The Developer Experience from Concept to Production

name: Learn JavaScript Los Angeles
description:
This group was formed in order to encourage aspiring web developers in Los Angeles to advance their learning together :)

Build incredible products using web development fundamentals in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. We hold weekly web-dev sessions on Tuesdays at Codesmith. Join other aspiring web developers and start building amazing products!

Learn callbacks, higher order functions (like map, reduce, filter, forEach) - the underscore and lowdash library array manipulation functions. Learn object oriented programming (how the new keyword works, how prototypes work etc) in JavaScript. Understand closure and scope in JavaScript. All classes are free and have an element of pair-programming - the best way to learn JavaScript and programming

Hosted at Codesmith HQ (5300 Beethoven St) every week on Tuesdays 6:30pm-8:00pm

Price: Always free

------

Meet the Host: Codesmith (codesmith.io) 

Codesmith teaches full stack software engineering in JavaScript through a 12 week immersive program. 

We teach computer science, object-oriented JavaScript, React, Angular, Node, distributed systems and mobile development so our grads can secure mid-to-senior level software engineering positions or launch their own ventures

The next cohort begins August 17. Apply at codesmith.io/apply. 

To apply for a scholarship, apply to the program at codesmith.io/apply. If you're admitted to the program, you'll then be able to apply for the scholarship. For further questions email admissions@codesmith.io

next_event.name: Framework Info Session: Part-Time JavaScript Program (online)

name: NodeAZ
description: @NodeAZ - Phoenix developer group for server-side JavaScript/CoffeeScript using Node.js. Real-time web, websockets, HTML5 and much more. 7PM 3rd Mon at UAT, rm 201

organizer.name: Chris Matthieu
organizer.bio: I have built and sold three cloud platform companies (Teleku, Nodester, and Octoblu).

name: Nodeschool Campinas
description: O Nodeschool Campinas é um grupo aberto e sem fins lucrativos com o objetivo de disseminar conhecimento sobre Node.js em Campinas e região. É o capítulo campineiro do mesmo Nodeschool existente ao redor do mundo.

name: FSJS - Full Stack JavaScript
description: from zero to hero mastering FSJS, we will cover, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, MongoDB, Express JS, Angular JS, Node JS, and other JS frameworks. Will meet for two hours one Sunday per month. The objective is to learn FSJS while helping each other with individual projects and eventually working on a group project. Meetups will consist of one hour of discussion/group learning and one hour of coding and helping each other with code. We will start with basic stuff and gradually move on to more advanced topics. No previous coding background is required, but if you are an expert we would love to learn from you.

organizer.name: Bryant K. Feld
organizer.bio: Sifu Bryant Feld has over 30 years experience in the Martial Arts including Aikido, Ving Tsun, Unarmed Combatives,Impact and Edged Weapons Training. He is available for semi-private and private instruction, seminars and work shops.

name: BlockchainHub Brussels
description:
BlockchainHub is a network of decentralised hubs that act autonomously, but share the same vision and goals. What started as a Berlin based Hub in 2015 has panned out into different cities.

Information Hub : People Hub : Thinking Hub

Blockchainhub Brussels is a think-tank and information platform connecting people around Blockchain in Belgium.

Blockchainhub Brussels is an independent non profit node of the global Blockchainhub network

• VISION

Spread the idea of decentralised technologies like blockchain and other technologies that build on top and around blockchain. Empower a more efficient & transparent p2p-economy and p2p-society.

• ACTIVITIES

Centralize and advertise events related to Blockchain on the Belgian territory.
Funnel and spread quality information linked to people or corporations based in Belgium.

• MISSION

Increase the understanding of distributed ledger technologies by informing, clarifying and raising awareness. Make it accessible to the general public.
Be an interdisciplinary think-tank and foster a breeding ground for game changing startups.

organizer.name: BlockchainHub Brussels
organizer.bio:
Information Hub : People Hub : Thinking Hub

Blockchainhub Brussels is a think-tank and information platform connecting people around Blockchain in Belgium.

Blockchainhub Brussels is an independent non profit node of the global Blockchainhub network

name: BackEnd/DevOps PH
description:
Welcome to the newest Back-End/DevOps/Security developer community in the Philippines! We host regular workshops and tech talks on a variety of different, related topics for all experience levels.

Feel free to post any DevOps or Back-End-related links, ideas, or questions, attend our upcoming events, and let us know if you want to help or speak in the future!

Relevant Job Postings from Sponsors:
https://goo.gl/WZsg3l

Our favorite topics: C, C++, C#, .NET, Node.js, NPM, Python, Docker, Kubernetes, Hosting, Security, Ruby, PHP, Perl, Golang, Continuous Integration and Delivery, etc

next_event.name: BackEnd/DevOps PH #3 - Are You a 0 or The One?

name: Tunis JavaScript Meetup Group
description:
This meetup group is open to all JavaScript developers that happen to be in Tunis. Whether you're interested in AngularJS, Ember.js, Backbone.js, Node.js, or even plain JavaScript you are more than welcome to join in and share with us your passion and experience. We will be organizing meetups to learn from each other and to get on track with the latest development of the web technologies in general.

Join our Google+ Community and follow us on Twitter

organizer.name: Marouen
organizer.bio: I'm Marouen from Tunisia, and I'm a Software Engineer and I'm very passionate about web development and programming in general.

name: Innsbrook .Net User Group
description:
The Innsbrook .NET User Group was formed to help bring new or different patterns, technology stacks, tools and languages from our community of developers to students and other developers of all skill levels. While there will be occasions for advanced level presentations, the bulk of presentations will be delivered so that students, entry level developers or developers with no experience in the technology being presented, will benefit from the topics covered.

Although the focus of the group is primarily around the .NET technology stack, the group will have presentations on a variety of tools, languages and platforms including Java, PHP, MySQL, MongoDB, MS SQL Server, jQuery and JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS, Node.Js and Knockout. Our goal is to introduce as much of a variety as we reasonably can.

The speakers for this group are local and regional developers with a passion for technology as well as sharing knowledge with fellow developers.

In addition to monthly User Group meetings we will provide occasional weekend boot camps where we will build entire working prototypes of various solutions as to facilitate deeper dives into various technologies.

name: Marina Del Rey Developer Meetup
description: If you heart development and live or work in Marina Del Rey come be part of a cutting edge community of developers. No recruiters, no salesman, just devs meeting devs... Especially love guys/girls working on Node, iOS dev, Android Dev, ROR, Front end, data science, growth hacking and other such fun topics.

organizer.name: Bobby Wall
organizer.bio: Leading a world class team of dedicated hard working engineers, building out advanced realtime navigation, routing, delivery, POS systems in the on-demand economy that is helping you save time by automating your errand of dry cleaning and laundry.

name: IoT Meetup Lausanne
description: This meetup is for everyone who's curious about the Internet of Things in Lausanne. We're going to be talking about IoT networks, nodes, architecture and devices.

name: Tri-Valley/East Bay Free Code Camp Study Group
description:
This is a study group for anyone currently learning web development. We are currently following the course at

Free Code Camp

.


What will happen at this meetup?

Problem solving, review of key subjects, presentations, meeting other software developers, helping each other and making connections.

Who should attend?

Anyone seriously involved in learning to code with JavaScript. Beginners and experienced developers. If you are not currently learning to code but are curious you can come to one of our coffee meet and greet sessions or come at the very beginning of a study session and we can discuss you interest and goals.

What technologies will we be leaning?

JavaScript, Node.js, React.js, D3.js, HTML5, CSS, Databases, Git/GitHub and a lot of best practices and; strategies for writing quality code.

Who is the host/organizer? Your organizer is Karl. I am an experienced software developer who has 10+ years experience working at major corporations. While I have done web development I am new to JavaScript and some of the associated technologies.

When will the first meetup take place, how often and where?

The first coffee meet & greet will be the week of April 18, 2016. Study/help sessions will be held in the Tri-Valley area (San Ramon, Danville, Pleasanton, etc.).

We will meet at a library or coffee shop. The group will have a regular once /week meeting time and additional sessions will be organized as desired. I am currently looking for a permenant home but will see where most members live before deciding upon a location.

organizer.name: Karl
organizer.bio:
Software Developer, Development Manager, Product Manager, Project Manager
C#, WPF/XAML, ASP.NET, MySQL, SQL Server, Sybase (distant past VB6, VBA)
Knowledge Management, Document Management, CRM
Learning JavaScript, Node.js & associated technologies

name: Valley Software Developers
description:
Valley Software Developers is devoted to being a social hub for valley technology geeks and teaching all sorts of programming languages.  While we tend to talk a lot about web scripting languages like Node.js, Python, PHP, Perl, Ruby, Javascript, TypeScript, Elm, etc we also encourage languages like Swift, C++, and Java.  We are a great place to learn about all sorts of software development, great for beginners and seasoned veterans as well.


See http://mslm.github.io/ for links and notes about past meetups!

organizer.name: Simeon Franklin
organizer.bio: Technical instructor for the late-great Marakana and since acquired by Twitter.

next_event.name: Learn Functional Programming With Elm | Elm-lang Crash Course Session 1

name: La Capsule Academy - Lyon
description:
Entrepreneurs, porteurs de projets, vous avez envie d’en connaître un peu plus sur le code et ses mystères ?

La Capsule Academy, une école de formation intensive au code pour les startups vous propose des sessions de workshop de 2 heures pour vous former efficacement !

Notre ADN ? Apporter une vision technique aux entrepreneurs pour mieux les armer face à leurs challenges.

Apportez vos ordis et venez découvrir la puissance et la simplicité de Javascript avec Node.js. Découvrez comment réaliser rapidement des pages responsives avec Bootstrap

Nous allons également vous expliquer ce qu’est une API en les manipulant au travers d’exemples concrets : connexion avec Facebook, Google map, envoi d’email avec Mailchimp…

Afin de proposer un apprentissage répondant aux problématiques des entrepreneurs et porteurs de projets, tous ces workshops seront abordés avec une approche Lean Startup

Explication, démo live et exercice pratique sont au programme. On vous attend !
